text: See if you qualify for a merit scholarship or tuition discount program in less than a minute. Complete the calculator for a detailed picture of your estimated expenses.

Western uses a rolling admissions policy, which allows students to apply at any time. The earlier you’re accepted, the better you’re set up for housing, classes and financial aid. If you’re accepted by
—and are eligible for merit aid—you’ll receive an additional $500 your first year.

to learn whether your GPA and test scores qualify you for a merit scholarship. If not, your state of residence could qualify you for 150 percent of in-state tuition via the Western Undergraduate Exchange (WUE) or Central Plains (CP) discount programs. — and are eligible for merit aid—you’ll receive an additional $500 your first year.
Look for this starting early December 2019.
You'll receive a tentative award in the mail, which is a first look at your estimated financial aid. Estimates include eligible scholarships, grants, work-study and loans.
Submit by March 1, 2020, for best award.
To optimize your eligibility for loans and grants, fill out the FAFSA at
After the priority deadline, you can still submit a FAFSA, although without priority status.

Once you’ve been accepted and completed a FAFSA, you will see your award by mail and Western email. Included will be the Financial Aid Checklist containing important instructions: how to accept full or partial loan amounts, complete entrance counseling and loan agreements.
Looking for more aid? You can apply for many scholarships via Western’s Common Scholarship Application. To browse and apply for scholarships, visit
For information about all Western scholarships, visit
Pay your tuition and housing deposits to lock in your place among Western’s Class of ’24. Class registration opens

. Tuition deposit must be submitted to take the registration survey, which is the key to building your first class schedule. Western’s housing survey becomes available in March; deposit by then to select a roommate and housing.
A first look at your actual charges.

You’ll receive your statement of charges in the mail or view it via MyWestern in early July. Take time to read carefully. Don’t be alarmed when scholarships, grants and loans aren’t applied right away; they disburse

After your aid disburses, you can pay your bill in full or set up monthly payments throughout the semester. Pay or set up a payment plan via your MyWestern account or by calling, emailing or visiting the
Navigate to your accelerated “3 2” program of interest to learn about its unique tuition and aid structure.
Graduate tuition, fees and aid vary between programs.
Money awarded based on academic or other achievements (e.g., merit, program based, athletic).
Aid based on financial need that doesn’t need to be repaid.
Western Undergraduate Exchange, Central Plains and Neighboring States programs.
Provides funding for students with financial need, allowing them to work on campus.
Borrowed money that must be paid back.

Our admissions team is here to guide you through the application process. Have a question? Reach out to the counselor corresponding to your location.
Follow our checklists as you prepare to come to Western. We can’t wait to see you here!

You enjoy a challenge, being pushed out of your comfort zone and trying new things. You’re academically driven and prefer courses where you interact with professors. You like hands-on learning and research. We do too. Start your journey of joining the Mountaineer family today.

The first video clip shows Western women’s soccer team playing a scrimmage game at night on the new soccer field. The second clip shows a sunrise at Dillon Pinnacles. The third clip shows an orchestra concert in Quigley Hall. The fourth clip shows Dr. Tim Brower speaking to a prospective student at Preview Day.
